2022-05-08T21:31:55Z: Thanks for joining us across this weirdly manic weekend - we'll see you in a couple of weeks' time with a return to your usual scheduling, with the Spanish GP coming up next. See you then!
2022-05-08T21:26:15Z: And...a post-race black-and-white flag for Alonso with regards to his track limits. So I guess that's no penalty, meaning he keeps P9.
2022-05-08T21:22:58Z: TONIGHT...Magnussen gets a five-second penalty for his contact with Stroll, Ricciardo gets a five-second penalty for leaving the track, and Sainz takes his shirt off.
2022-05-08T21:21:49Z: The top three jump on buggies to get to the podium, plus police escort. What is this...
2022-05-08T21:18:00Z: Magnussen gets a black and white flag after the race is over for weaving on the straight. Don't know how it's possible to have post-race flags, but there we are.
2022-05-08T21:17:14Z: Alonso has a further investigation awaiting him, apparently leaving the track and gaining an advantage. Meanwhile, the Vettel/Schumacher incident will receive no further action.
2022-05-08T21:12:07Z: Albon was just 0.2s off doubling his fun, but still, the lucky red hair continues to give him the rub of the green.
2022-05-08T21:09:37Z: Russell beats Hamilton to fifth, as Bottas takes seventh, Ocon eighth, Alonso ninth after a late Alpine switch and Albon taking his second point of the year.
2022-05-08T21:08:51Z: Leclerc had a good go at the end - but settles for second, as Sainz holds third ahead of Perez.
2022-05-08T21:08:16Z: That's a Miami Grand Prix win for Max Verstappen!
2022-05-08T21:07:20Z: All that midfield carnage has promoted Ocon to ninth and Albon to 10th.
2022-05-08T21:06:51Z: Elsewhere a Schumacher vs Ricciardo incident is also under investigation for one of them leaving the track and gaining an advantage.
2022-05-08T21:05:46Z: Vettel has retired to the pits having suffered huge damage to his sidepod, while Schumacher pits for tyres and a front wing. That incident is under investigation by the race stewards.
2022-05-08T21:04:49Z: It's a 1m31.361s for Verstappen, four tenths clear of Leclerc. That's probably it for now. Let's wrap it up so we can knock off early.
2022-05-08T21:04:34Z: Oh no! The Schumacher and Vettel love in is over as the pair clash! Vettel had got ahead of him and Ocon at Turn 17 but the battle continued to Turn 1 and Schumacher and Vettel crash at the apex.
2022-05-08T21:02:51Z: Leclerc's giving it his all here, but Verstappen might have seen the worst of a choppy restart and is just stretching out the gap now.
2022-05-08T21:02:09Z: Stroll gets by Magnussen for 14th on lap 53.
2022-05-08T21:00:20Z: Perez absolutely launches it down the inside of Sainz into Turn 1 at the start of lap 52, but just overcooked it, and the two were millimetres away from contact! Sainz holds third for now!
2022-05-08T20:59:54Z: Schumacher is somehow hanging on to ninth place with Ocon, on his fresh softs, still all over his rear wing.
2022-05-08T20:59:07Z: Stroll has now been shown the black and white flag for weaving on the straight.
2022-05-08T20:58:30Z: Magnussen vs Stroll ends up with no further action from the race stewards. Case closed.
2022-05-08T20:57:54Z: Leclerc had a look into Turn 11! He got DRS on Verstappen, probably went a bit deep but he gets another dose of DRS into Turn 17 to catch back up. Sainz holds off Perez, Russell passes Hamilton. Blimey.
2022-05-08T20:57:24Z: Magnussen vs Stroll is now under investigation - the pair are still running nose to tail in 14th and 15th.
2022-05-08T20:56:40Z: Meanwhile, Bottas goes too deep into Turn 17 and gets tag-teamed by both Mercedes! Hamilton's up to fifth, with Russell now sixth.
2022-05-08T20:55:21Z: Sainz, meanwhile, goes wide into Turn 17 and will surely be vulnerable to Perez now that DRS is enabled.
2022-05-08T20:54:45Z: Leclerc's not letting go of Verstappen for now, as the Monegasque seems to have fired up his tyres quickest, but Verstappen now gaps him ever so slightly.
2022-05-08T20:54:00Z: Stroll vs Magnussen has been noted by FIA race control. Further ahead Schumacher in ninth on older hards is defending hard against Ocon on fresh softs.
2022-05-08T20:53:23Z: Verstappen and Leclerc have legged it - Perez is trying to get closer to Sainz into Turn 17 but Sainz is hanging on for now.
2022-05-08T20:52:32Z: Stroll has a disaster restart dropping from 12th to 15th after a clash with Magnussen.
2022-05-08T20:51:46Z: Verstappen backs the pack up along the straight, guns it out of the hairpin and lets it fly. We're racing, and Perez already has Sainz in his sights.
2022-05-08T20:50:52Z: Gasly has pitted having reported damage - which was a given due to his coming together with Alonso and then Norris. So he's the third retirement from this race.
2022-05-08T20:49:28Z: The safety car is coming in at the end of lap 46. Which is this lap if you are counting.
2022-05-08T20:47:56Z: That's all lapped cars, not any lapped cars - just for the record.
2022-05-08T20:47:44Z: The lapped cars - Gasly, Tsunoda and Latifi - have been allowed to overtake the safety to unlap themselves. Insert Abu Dhabi GP hot take here.
2022-05-08T20:45:31Z: Ocon (10th), Ricciardo (15th), Gasly (16th), Tsunoda (18th) have all pitted for soft tyres, while Stroll (12th), Magnussen (13th) and Vettel (14th) are on the mediums.
2022-05-08T20:43:06Z: It isn't how anyone expected it, but that has totally shaken up this race. There's still debris on track at the exit of Turn 7, so this safety car period will continue for a while yet.
2022-05-08T20:41:21Z: That's put Perez in a nice spot, he'll be on the Ferrari drivers' tail with newer, faster tyres. Think Ferrari's missed a trick here.
2022-05-08T20:41:01Z: Meanwhile Alonso has been given a five-second penalty for causing his clash with Gasly.
2022-05-08T20:40:08Z: So Russell took a cheap stop under the VSC, emerging in seventh, as Perez stops from fourth place and remains as such with medium tyres.
2022-05-08T20:40:12Z: Oh, that was messy. Gasly was running slowly around Turn 7, potentially with damage after earlier contact with Alonso, and barges into Norris which destroys his right-rear tyre. Now the full safety car is out.
2022-05-08T20:37:43Z: Norris and Gasly have clashed! The McLaren driver has suffered damage and is out of this race! Virtual Safety Car!
2022-05-08T20:34:30Z: Is rain on the way? That'd spice up this relatively tepid race with 18 laps to go.
2022-05-08T20:31:23Z: Vettel locks up at Turn 7 and runs wide, giving a freebie overtake to Norris, treating the fans at the fake marina to some real action.
2022-05-08T20:28:53Z: Magnussen runs wide at Turn 17 which allows team-mate Schumacher to nip through - was that a deliberate team move? It looked like it.
2022-05-08T20:27:22Z: Snark aside, Leclerc drops a 1m32.366s to cut the gap down again - so that's added some degree of jeopardy into the fight. Sort of.
2022-05-08T20:26:40Z: The Haas vs Vettel battle has allowed Stroll to scamper up the road by four seconds, while Norris has tagged into DRS range of Vettel.
2022-05-08T20:25:36Z: Gap in the lead is now up to 8s as Verstappen punches in a 1m32.742s. Good to see Miami offering a wildly difficult spectacle.
2022-05-08T20:24:46Z: Vettel has had a nightmare of a lap and has lost places to both Haas drivers. Arguably this is the battle of the race, even if it is only for 12th place.
2022-05-08T20:23:33Z: Ricciardo finally pits on lap 31 to ditch his mediums for hards and comes out in 17th place.
2022-05-08T20:22:42Z: Vettel bites back at Magnussen to regain 13th place place. The Dane got poor drive out of Turn 16 and that allowed Vettel to reel him in and dive up the inside at Turn 17.
2022-05-08T20:22:23Z: It's a 1m32.779s for Verstappen on lap 30 - he's 7.7s up on Leclerc.  So, bit of a foregone conclusion at this stage - the front pack are very spread out.
2022-05-08T20:20:24Z: Ricciardo is the only driver who started on the mediums and is yet to pit, which partly explains his climb to eighth place currently. Is he hoping for a safety car so he can make a cheap pitstop?
2022-05-08T20:19:07Z: Magnussen has got ahead of Vettel to take 13th place and now he is going after Stroll. The Aston Martins are the jokers in the pack with both drivers yet to pit having started on the hards from the pitlane.
2022-05-08T20:18:43Z: It's as you were in the top four: Verstappen leads from Leclerc at the start of lap 29, from Sainz and Perez. Russell is fifth, but he's yet to stop as Bottas is sixth - still ahead of Hamilton.
2022-05-08T20:17:35Z: Sainz is in for his stop, also taking hard tyres - but it's slow! He ships 2s in the pits to Perez as Ferrari has a bit of finger trouble in the pits with the front-right wheel nut.
2022-05-08T20:16:32Z: It is turning into a tough race for Tsunoda and Latifi at the back of the field, both running well off the pace of the rest.
2022-05-08T20:16:25Z: Leclerc, meanwhile, is 6s off Verstappen after their opening stops, but he's just done a 1m33.054s to close in.
2022-05-08T20:15:40Z: Verstappen duly pits for hard tyres at the end of lap 26, trading medium tyres for hards with a swift stop at Red Bull. He emerges in P2 for now, ahead of Perez, as Sainz is yet to stop.
2022-05-08T20:12:55Z: Leclerc emerges in fourth place, ahead of Valtteri Bottas. Red Bull sees no reason to react to Leclerc's movements just yet.
2022-05-08T20:12:34Z: Alonso, in 11th, is leading a DRS train ahead of the pitlane-starting Astons of Stroll and Vettel and then Haas pair Magnussen and Schumacher. It is leaving them all stuck in position.
2022-05-08T20:10:10Z: Leclerc isn't quite done yet - it's a 1m33.141s to now take the fastest lap honours.
2022-05-08T20:09:32Z: Hamilton, meanwhile, pits for hard tyres from sixth place - and rejoins in seventh ahead of Ricciardo.
2022-05-08T20:08:50Z: Verstappen's doing all he can to clock off early, posting a 1m33.193s on the 22nd lap to extend his lead. He's looking unflappable out in front.
2022-05-08T20:08:38Z: Magnussen's lap is an eventful one as he catches a slide at Turn 17 but it means he loses a chunk of time chasing after Vettel.
2022-05-08T20:07:07Z: Magnussen shows his front wing around the outside of Vettel at Turn 11 but on the switch back for Turn 12 he runs wide and backs out of the move.
2022-05-08T20:05:32Z: Norris is struggling on his hard tyres, as he goes deep at Turn 17 and is overtaken by Schumacher.
2022-05-08T20:05:23Z: Perez complains he's losing a lot of power, losing a ton of time to Sainz. Red Bull says it looks okay, but Perez vehemently disagrees with the team's assessment.
2022-05-08T20:03:53Z: Norris is the next to pit, a tardy 3.6s stop, and at pit exit he loses places to Vettel and Magnussen on his cold tyres.
2022-05-08T20:02:42Z: Gasly pitted a lap after Alonso to cover the undercut attempt, but due to the Alpine driver's slow stop Gasly is now 4.4s up the road.
2022-05-08T20:02:26Z: Leclerc's chipped away at Verstappen on each of the last two laps - only a couple of tenths here and there, but he's keeping tabs on the leader.
2022-05-08T20:01:35Z: Latifi is getting rather swamped, this time by the Haas pair on fresh tyres, as Magnussen and Schumacher overtake him in quick succession to push the Canadian back to 17th.
2022-05-08T20:01:32Z: Fifth-placed Bottas is re-opening up the gap over Hamilton, bringing his advantage back up to over three seconds. Pace in that Alfa.
2022-05-08T20:00:37Z: Super racing at the back of the pack as Vettel runs side-by-side with Latifi around a fake beach and gets the move done into Turn 13 to take 14th place.
2022-05-08T19:59:04Z: Alonso, who had been stuck behind Gasly, has a slow stop at 5.7s due to a ticky tyre and comes out in 13th place.
2022-05-08T19:58:59Z: Verstappen did a 1m33.510 at the end of lap 15 to extend his advantage over Leclerc, but was more or less on-par with the Ferrari on the following tour.
2022-05-08T19:57:10Z: Schumacher pits at the end of lap 14, also going from mediums to hards, and comes out 3.2s behind his Haas team-mate.
2022-05-08T19:56:25Z: After losing time to Bottas earlier, Hamilton's reversing the arrears and is now within two seconds of his former team-mate.
2022-05-08T19:55:49Z: Russell has fired up his hards now and gets a bit of a freebie overtake, as Ricciardo goes wide at Turn 17, which allows the Brit to charge by into 11th place.
2022-05-08T19:53:53Z: Magnussen is the next into the pits, also going from the mediums to the hards, and comes back out in 18th place.
2022-05-08T19:53:44Z: Leclerc's gone a bit too deep into Turn 17 on that past lap, losing a second to Verstappen last time around. It's now lap 13, which could be unlucky for some.
2022-05-08T19:52:31Z: Tsunoda becomes the first driver to pit in this race, pitting at the end of lap 11, trading in his mediums for fresh hards
2022-05-08T19:51:39Z: The Haas drivers have traded places, with Magnussen taking 10th place off Schumacher.
2022-05-08T19:50:06Z: On lap 10 Ricciardo has overtaken Tsunoda to take 12th place. The Aussie charged up the inside at Turn 1 which appears to already be the favoured overtaking spot on this new track.
2022-05-08T19:50:02Z: And lap 10 proved to be a bit iffy for Leclerc, who shipped 0.7s over the lap to lose touch with the leader.
2022-05-08T19:48:42Z: Leclerc has kept with Verstappen in the opening couple of sectors - but the Red Bull scampers down the road along the back straight to keep his lead well out of arm's reach.
2022-05-08T19:47:18Z: The Dutchman gets really close in the final few corners, and now cruises past Leclerc into Turn 1 at the start of lap 9 - barely a contest, such is the pace of the Red Bull!
2022-05-08T19:46:20Z: Verstappen's right in DRS range of Leclerc now, he could have a real shot as he's gaining quite a lot at this juncture...
2022-05-08T19:45:33Z: Hamilton is now in free air, but he's not closing down Bottas at this rate - if anything, Bottas is opening up the gap to his former team-mate.
2022-05-08T19:44:53Z: Zhou is the first race retirement as he pits at the end of lap seven. Cruel luck for the F1 rookie.
2022-05-08T19:44:05Z: Tsunoda has been swamped by the Haas, with both Schumacher and Magnussen getting by the end of lap six.
2022-05-08T19:42:09Z: At the start of lap six Hamilton dives ahead of Gasly at Turn 1 to reclaim sixth place.
2022-05-08T19:41:35Z: Verstappen's got a 1m34.287s for the time being, but Leclerc posts a 1m33.963s to stretch his legs a little bit.
2022-05-08T19:40:49Z: TV replays of the start show Alonso banged his right-front wheel face to face with Hamilton's left-rear which caused the Mercedes driver to lose momentum and drop back.
2022-05-08T19:39:28Z: Further back Ocon has got ahead of Latifi into 17th place, while Stroll leads team-mate Vettel at the back of the field.
2022-05-08T19:38:28Z: On lap three Hamilton gets back by Alonso with the aid of DRS on the run to Turn 11. The Mercedes driver is now seventh and chasing after Gasly - it is Imola all over again!
2022-05-08T19:36:51Z: Leclerc's putting his foot down in front, trying to keep Verstappen out of DRS range off the bat as the Red Bull has some legs on the straights.
2022-05-08T19:36:10Z: Ricciardo also made a rapid start going from 14th to 11th place on the first lap, while Russell, on the hards, has dropped from 12th to 15th.
2022-05-08T19:35:01Z: Hamilton has a poor start, locking up at Turn 1, and loses places to Gasly and Alonso to drop to eighth place. Both Aston Martins are in this race starting from pitlane.
2022-05-08T19:34:55Z: Leclerc gets away well, as Verstappen forces his way past Sainz to move up to second! Perez and Bottas continue to follow, continuing from where they began.
2022-05-08T19:33:51Z: And here it is - the Miami Grand Prix begins!
2022-05-08T19:31:09Z: The formation lap is now under way.
2022-05-08T19:28:16Z: Tyre check: hard tyres for Stroll, Russell, Vettel, Latifi and Ocon. Mediums for the rest.
2022-05-08T19:26:43Z: There is a tangible risk of rain for this race, 40% according to F1's stats.
2022-05-08T19:25:30Z: Five minutes to go, everybody! Are we excited?
2022-05-08T19:15:24Z: Apparent fuel issue for both Astons - they're trying to get going from the pits. More on that as we have it.
2022-05-08T19:14:48Z: Our own Luke Smith and Jess McFadyen have just appeared on TV - so they're celebrities now. I knew them BEFORE they were on the telly...
2022-05-08T19:08:33Z: It appears, according to our folks on the ground, that Lance Stroll's P10 grid slot is bare - as is Vettel's P13 slot. Pitlane starts for the Aston duo?
2022-05-08T19:00:15Z: 30 minutes until lights out, I guess. Still, it's probably better than starting a race at 10-past...
2022-05-08T18:56:05Z: Bit of dissent in the ranks about our Sebring joke - to clarify, we most certainly are not better than that. As Ayrton Senna possibly said, 'if you no longer go for the pun that exists, you are no longer a journalist'...
2022-05-08T18:54:13Z: Not too long to go now...wait, it starts at half-past? Who signed this off? Who does anything at half-past?
2022-05-08T18:46:19Z: Rain watch: it's stopped. For now. You're welcome.
2022-05-08T18:44:42Z: The reason why they're racing in Miami rather than another Floridian circuit is due to the jewellery clampdown. They don't allow Seb-rings in F1 any more...
2022-05-08T18:41:17Z: Twitter is abound with teams and drivers sharing pictures with celebrities, as Miami has attracted all the great and the good. But I met Lizo Mzimba off the news at Glastonbury one year, so beat that F1...
2022-05-08T18:38:39Z: There's been bits of drizzle throughout the day, but if rain starts to affect the race we could be in for a bit of...Miami spice. Miami spice. You know, Lewan-GOAL-ski.
2022-05-08T18:36:00Z: With under an hour to go until lights out, there's allegedly spits and/or spots of rain in the air around the circuit. Allegedly.
2022-05-08T18:28:21Z: The Miami International Autodrome has proven to be a challenging circuit for the drivers to get on top of, as they dazzle the audience in attendance around the Hard Rock Stadium, and the nearby definitely-a-marina.
2022-05-08T18:26:44Z: Good - checks time - evening everyone, welcome to our Autosport Live coverage of the inaugural Miami Grand Prix. We'll have updates throughout the race as events begin to unfold.
